intro: Euphrasia muscosa, commonly known as the mossy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with prominent yellow spots, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, and it often forms dense mats in its natural habitat. Euphrasia muscosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
